properties.areaDesc: Southeast Warren; Northern Warren; Western Windham; Northern Saratoga; Bennington; Southern Washington; Northern Washington; Eastern Windham
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 10 at 10:28PM EST by NWS Albany NY
properties.description:
Patchy dense fog will continue to develop across portions of the
upper Hudson Valley, including the Lake George Saratoga region,
and southern Vermont, especially eastern Windham County, where
some visibilities may drop to under one quarter of a mile.

In addition, many ground surfaces remain wet from snow which
melted during the daytime. However, as temperatures continue
dropping below freezing, patchy black ice may form, especially on
untreated ground surfaces including roadways, driveways and
parking lots.

Motorists and pedestrians should use extra caution overnight, as
ground surfaces which look wet may actually be ice covered and
extremely slippery. Motorists should also remain vigilant to rapid
reductions in visibility, which could drop to near zero in
isolated areas.

NWSheadline: PATCHY DENSE FOG AND BLACK ICE LIKELY OVERNIGHT
